docs.snippet: U.S. Rep. Corrine Brown of Florida and her chief of staff pleaded not guilty Friday to multiple fraud charges and other federal offenses in a grand jury indictment unsealed after an investigation into what prosecutors call a phony charity turned i...
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Rep. Corrine Brown of Florida and her chief of staff pleaded not guilty Friday to multiple fraud charges and other federal offenses in a grand jury indictment unsealed after an investigation into what prosecutors call a phony charity turned into a personal slush fund.

headline.main: US Rep. Corrine Brown Indicted After Fraud Investigation
headline.print_headline: US Rep. Corrine Brown Indicted After Fraud Investigation

docs.snippet: Inspiration tends to find Patrick Chappatte at the kitchen table in his studio rather than at his desk: “It’s closer to the espresso machine.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: Inspiration tends to find Patrick Chappatte at the kitchen table in his studio rather than at his desk: “It’s closer to the espresso machine.”

docs.snippet: Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull looked almost certain to retain power after a bruising national election as key independent lawmakers pledged support and marathon vote counting in close-run electorates leaned in his favor on Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull looked almost certain to retain power after a bruising national election as key independent lawmakers pledged support and marathon vote counting in close-run electorates leaned in his favor on Friday.

headline.main: Australian PM Almost Certain Victor in Election but No Celebration
headline.print_headline: Australian PM Almost Certain Victor in Election but No Celebration

docs.snippet: Mrs. Clinton has slowly owned up to the trustworthiness problem. But it will take more than acknowledgment to fix the issue....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mrs. Clinton has slowly owned up to the trustworthiness problem. But it will take more than acknowledgment to fix the issue.
docs.abstract: Hillary Clinton, speaking in Chicago, signals shift in her presidential campaign strategy to try and directly address the lack of trust in her among likely voters.

headline.main: A More Personal Hillary Clinton Tries to Erase a Trust Deficit
headline.print_headline: A More Personal Clinton Tries to Rebuild Trust With Voters

docs.snippet: Americans' demand for an alternative to the two main presidential candidates has surged since the last election, a Reuters/Ipsos opinion poll shows, underscoring the unpopularity of Republican Donald Trump and Democrat Hillary Clinton....
docs.lead_paragraph: Americans' demand for an alternative to the two main presidential candidates has surged since the last election, a Reuters/Ipsos opinion poll shows, underscoring the unpopularity of Republican Donald Trump and Democrat Hillary Clinton.

headline.main: Faced With Trump and Clinton, Americans Yearn for Third Choice: Reuters/Ipsos Poll
headline.print_headline: Faced With Trump and Clinton, Americans Yearn for Third Choice: Reuters/Ipsos Poll

docs.snippet: In this heated and deeply divisive campaign year, America's presidential candidates responded Friday with striking reflection and restraint to the week's killings of five police officers and two black men....

docs.snippet: The House overwhelmingly approved a compromise package bolstering federal steps against illicit drugs on Friday, as lawmakers of both parties flocked to cast an election-year vote to stem the nation's surge of deaths among drug abusers....
docs.lead_paragraph: The House overwhelmingly approved a compromise package bolstering federal steps against illicit drugs on Friday, as lawmakers of both parties flocked to cast an election-year vote to stem the nation's surge of deaths among drug abusers.

headline.main: House OKs Compromise Bill Reinforcing Anti-Drug Programs
headline.print_headline: House OKs Compromise Bill Reinforcing Anti-Drug Programs

docs.snippet: U.S. President Barack Obama expressed concern on Friday over Poland's moves to shackle its constitutional court, in unusually blunt comments calling on the former communist EU country's government to do more to protect democracy....

headline.print_headline: Poland Should Do More to Address Constitutional Court Concerns-Obama

docs.snippet: Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg says she doesn't want to think about the possibility of Donald Trump winning the White House, and she predicts the next president — "whoever she will be" — will have a few appointments to make to the Supreme...
docs.lead_paragraph: Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg says she doesn't want to think about the possibility of Donald Trump winning the White House, and she predicts the next president — "whoever she will be" — will have a few appointments to make to the Supreme Court.

headline.main: AP Interview: Ginsburg Doesn't Want to Envision a Trump Win
headline.print_headline: AP Interview: Ginsburg Doesn't Want to Envision a Trump Win

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama on Friday tried to channel Americans' horror and outrage over the targeted shootings of police officers, decrying the fatal attack in Dallas as "despicable" and declaring there was no justification for the violence....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama on Friday tried to channel Americans' horror and outrage over the targeted shootings of police officers, decrying the fatal attack in Dallas as "despicable" and declaring there was no justification for the violence.

headline.main: Obama Says America Is Horrified Over Dallas Attack
